intro: Tristylea, commonly known as the "butterfly fern," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that resemble butterflies, hence its common name. The plants typically have a short, stocky rhizome with fleshy, fibrous roots. Tristylea species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where they thrive in moist, shaded environments. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique and vibrant floral displays.
